byline.original: By MATT LEE and TED LEE

abstract: Roasting directly on coals can give meats robust, earthy char on outside and reduce grilling times; recipe for coffee-chile dry rub given.
lead_paragraph: Cooking meat directly on glowing hardwood coals creates a char that is robust and earthy, but never too ashy or excessive.

headline.main: For a Better Steak, Cook Directly on Charcoal
headline.print_headline: Heeding Your Inner Rambo at the Grill

snippet: Cooking meat directly on glowing hardwood coals creates a char that is robust and earthy, but never too ashy or excessive.
